dcterms:creator: Chris M. Bishop
dcterms:description: The paper discusses the equivalence of training with noise and Tikhonov regularization, which is relevant for improving neural network performance.

dcterms:creator: Yarin Gal
Zoubin Ghahramani
dcterms:description: This work provides a theoretical foundation for the application of dropout in recurrent neural networks, addressing potential memory loss issues.

dcterms:creator: Felix A. Gers
Jürgen Schmidhuber
Fred Cummins
dcterms:description: The paper presents a method for continual prediction using LSTM networks, which is relevant for understanding memory and learning in neural networks.

dcterms:creator: Alex Graves
Jürgen Schmidhuber
dcterms:description: This research focuses on framewise phoneme classification using bidirectional LSTM and other architectures, contributing to speech recognition tasks.

dcterms:creator: Geoffrey E. Hinton
Nitish Srivastava
Alex Krizhevsky
Ilya Sutskever
Ruslan R. Salakhutdinov
dcterms:description: The authors propose dropout as a technique to prevent overfitting in neural networks, which is crucial for improving generalization.

dcterms:creator: Sepp Hochreiter
Jürgen Schmidhuber
dcterms:description: This foundational paper introduces Long Short-Term Memory (LSTM) networks, addressing the vanishing gradient problem in recurrent networks.

dcterms:creator: R. Jozefowicz
W. Zaremba
I. Sutskever
dcterms:description: This empirical study explores various architectures of recurrent networks, contributing to the understanding of their performance.

dcterms:creator: Stanislau Semeniuta
Aliaksei Severyn
Erhardt Barth
dcterms:description: This paper discusses recurrent dropout techniques that mitigate memory loss in recurrent neural networks.

dcterms:creator: Nitish Srivastava
Geoffrey Hinton
Alex Krizhevsky
Ilya Sutskever
Ruslan Salakhutdinov
dcterms:description: This work presents dropout as a simple yet effective method to prevent overfitting in neural networks.

dcterms:creator: Lizhong Wu
John Moody
dcterms:description: This paper introduces a smoothing regularizer for both feedforward and recurrent neural networks, contributing to regularization techniques.

dcterms:creator: Wojciech Zaremba
Ilya Sutskever
Oriol Vinyals
dcterms:description: This paper discusses regularization techniques for recurrent neural networks, contributing to the understanding of their training.
